871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (01:52): could some one give me a hand on a tomcat+apache issue that I'm having ?
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (01:52): I followed these instruction on setting it up http://www.meritonlinesystems.com/docs/apache_tomcat_redhat.html
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (01:53): for some reason I get not much on my logs and also when I do get something is just a GET /servlet/HelloWorld HTTP/1.1" 400
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (01:56): and what exactly is the problem?
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:00): all I get is a blank page
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:00): and my tomcat logs show nothing
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:09): what happens if you call the HelloWorld servlet directly
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:14): I got change the configuration to do so
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:14): but I know when I first installed tomcat and had it running standalone on 8080 all the servlets and jsp examples worked
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:14): why did you removed port 8080 either way?
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:15): I just another sample.war from apache and that doesn't work either i get the same 400 error
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:15): and you tried the same war file with a standalone tomcat?
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:15): dvayanu: the instructions I was following made me create a new server.xml file
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:22): yeah it works fine on the 8080
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:22): now I got redo my apache configs for the virtual server that is using mod_jk
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:27): btw when I go to localhost:8080 where is that directed to , do you know ? I want to add that same location to my vhost documentroot
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:29): btorch: i'm not an expert like jasonb, but i pasted you parts of my apache2.conf
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:30): i'm not so sure it's 100% correct
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:31): alright I made some changes on my apache
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:31): got the DocRoot to be the same as the catalina root
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:37): the only thing that does not seem to work is calling by servlets
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:39): well the proper way to invoke a servlet is to define a mapping in the web.xml
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:39): which is located in your webapp/WEB-INF folder
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:39): well the only that I did now was to set my apache vhost root to point to /opt/apache-tomcat/webapps
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:39): when you call the servlet via servlet/className you are actually calling the invoker servlet
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:40): that is automatically redirected to the tomcat main page
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:40): which is defined in the web.xml in the conf dir of your tomcat
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:40): from there I can try to test the jsp examples but the servlets don't work .. both work fine if I go through the 8080
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:41): what I'm testing now is the default the comes with tomcat under its webapps directory
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:41): btorch: check your web.xml, the invoker servlet is disabled by default, cause its a security hole (small one)
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:41): its like it can't read the web.xml under the WEB-INF
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:42): btorch: are you invoking a mapped servlet?
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:42): got it the main conf/web.xml you mean righ t?
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:42): there is an invoker section that is commented out
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:43): btorch: what path are you loading exactly
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:45): then you need the invoker i think
871823fa47b3336b34ddcbaf94d58373 (02:45): hey thank you very much for your help but I got go now ... I figure the rest out later on

84c66ffaf53e2e43ffc23f409f06fa26 (02:50): org.apache.jasper.JasperException: Unable to compile class for JSP  Generated servlet error: Only a type can be imported. org.apache.soap.Constants resolves to a package
38e6faf7dfe6481392abfcf94781a567 (02:52): you dont include a needed package that your build is pinting to
84c66ffaf53e2e43ffc23f409f06fa26 (02:52): the problem is I cant find any intructions for SOAP and Tomcat 5.x

31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:56): totic: search the tomcats bugzilla, there were some discussion on the user list and in bugzilla (issues.apache.org) some time ago

31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:56): it seems that you have both, a class named ...soap.Constants and a package soap.constants....
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:56): i'm not sure that this bug is fixed though
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (02:57): it must be marked as jasper bug
84c66ffaf53e2e43ffc23f409f06fa26 (02:57): An error occurred at line: 5 in the jsp file: /admin/list.jsp Generated servlet error: Constants.CONFIGFILENAME cannot be resolved to a type
